heading: Overhead
description: An expense tracking app with Data persistence and live data sync that helps users track their expenses but settings monthly limits, data visualisations using charts and getting helpful reminders through local notifications.

heading: Meals to Go
technologies: React Native Maps (Google and Apple Maps)
description: A Zomato-esque clone made in React Native, where you can search for a city and see all the restaurants available in it, either in a list or a map view. You can go on to add them to favourites, and view favourites in a Horizontal Carousal or a favourites list in your profile section, or browse the menus available for the restaurants. The login and registration is handled through Firebase auth, and profile settings are persisted through Async Storage.

heading: Capital Cities
description: A demo project to practice with MapKit. Lists out a few preselected capitals in Europe, with a variety of different views to choose from, creates a marker on their location, with special callout views that can navigate the user to an app managed web-view containing the wikipedia articles on the same.

heading: Bookheads
description: A Book rating and review app made with SwiftUI, with data modeling and persistence done through Core Data.

heading: Apple Stocks Clone
description: A clone of the Apple Stocks App made with SwiftUI in MVVM Pattern.

heading: News App
description: A news app made with UIKit in MVVM pattern, that consumes the top-news endpoint of newsapi.org API

heading: Ode To Luna
description: A commemorative to humanity's trysts with our closest celestial neighbor, Ode to Luna is a an app that lists the Apollo missions, their details and the briefs about the astronauts that went to the moon. Made with SwiftUI in MVVM Pattern.

heading: Filter it
description: An App made with UIKit and CoreImage to take an image, either by clicking it on camera or from the photo library, and applying Apple's built-in images onto the image, with user having various choices in the form of various filters, their intensities, etc.

heading: Count My Coffee
description: An iOS App that tells user when to have their last coffee for a good night's sleep based on these three questions, when do they want to wake up, roughly how many hours of sleep do they want and finally how many cups of coffee do they drink per day?

heading: PlantTester
description: A Dummy App to practice my testing chops. The app has a simple functionality, where on searching Name, Scientific Name or Phylum, you'll get the results back from Trefle API. The interesting part is the testing process, on every push the repo is pushed to Bitrise where it build and run Unit and UI Tests and send the reports and test artifacts through mails to stakeholders. There is also the functionality to setup Auto-Sanity at regular timeframes, or trigger testing on manually for a particular branch or commit.

heading: Email Reports
description: A python program to collate the artifacts generated during Automated UI testing during Bitrise builds, generate reports on the success or failure and relevant details regarding the same, and email them to a list of recipients based on the settings in Bitrise Workflow. This was developed for the aforementioned PlantTester Application, but with a few tweaks can be used for collating any test artifacts on any android build on Bitrise.

heading: Step Runner
description: A vertical infinite runner that requires both and skill and luck to get good at.
